importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott reported missing on this date after leaving an overnight shift at an assisted living facility, marking the beginning of the investigation into her disappearance.
The black Hyundai Accent was reported stolen on this date, and video evidence shows it parked near where Scott’s body was later found, linking it to her disappearance.
The stolen vehicle was reportedly on fire three days after Scott disappeared, leading to charges of arson and conspiracy against Keon King.
The remains of Kada Scott were found behind an abandoned school, and authorities confirmed her identity via DNA testing, leading to a major public update on the case.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe of Scott's disappearance and the subsequent theft and burning of the Hyundai Accent occurs within a narrow window, indicating a possible connection between the events and the suspect's movements.

keyTakeAways: Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman, was identified through DNA testing as the individual whose remains were found behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia after being missing for about two weeks.
Keon King, a 21-year-old from Dover, Delaware, was arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, causing or risking a catastrophe, conspiracy, and other related charges.
A tip led investigators back to the school where the remains were discovered in a shallow grave, indicating the case had been previously searched without success.
The black Hyundai Accent was stolen the day before Scott went missing and was seen parked near the recreation center where she was last seen, with video evidence linking the vehicle to her case.
The vehicle was later found on fire and compacted at a junkyard, preventing full inspection, which may have hindered early investigation.
Authorities believe other individuals may have been involved in the case after the initial events and are still investigating.
King previously faced kidnapping charges in another case that were dropped due to lack of prosecution attendance, suggesting a pattern of similar offenses.
Kada Scott was remembered by her parents as a source of 'light, kindness and beautiful spirit,' highlighting the personal and emotional impact of her disappearance.
District Attorney Larry Krasner stated that homicide charges are expected but will be pursued only if legally justified, emphasizing due process and constitutional obligations.
A new tip instructed investigators to 'go back, she’s there, look again,' which led to the discovery of the remains, showing the critical role of public tips in solving missing persons cases.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of 23-year-old Kada Scott, who had been missing for about two weeks, were discovered behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia. Authorities say an anonymous tip led them back to the site, where they found her in a shallow grave. DNA testing confirmed her identity. Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and other offenses. Evidence, including cellphone location data and video showing a stolen black Hyundai Accent parked near where Scott was last seen, links King to the case. The vehicle was later found on fire and was destroyed before full inspection. King had a prior history of similar charges, which were dropped due to lack of court appearances. Prosecutors say more charges are in development, including homicide, and believe others may have been involved. Scott, who worked in an assisted living facility, was remembered by her parents as a source of kindness and light. The case underscores the importance of public tips and thorough investigations in missing persons cases.
title: Remains found behind abandoned school belong to missing Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, officials say
